page.title: 12Cleobury Mortimer
page.content: Rising from the valley of the River Rea, Cleobury nestles at the very foot of Clee Hill. It has two main features, a beautiful church (partly Norman) with a crooked spire, and a twisting, undulating, main street where the town's commercial establishments are to be found. The goods and services they offer are many and varied. In recent years the main street has been padded out on all sides with residential developments. Currently houses are being constructed on Lea View and Tenbury Road. The town has a large population of senior citizens for whom special provisions are made, such as bungalow accommodation, meals on wheels, Darby and Joan Club, free transport to and from the Medical Centre and, recently, a Day Centre. A monthly charity coach trip is organised for them.
